Welcome to Mini 1481 - ETL's Horrific Camping Trip

After being lost in the mountains for 6 days, you and your camping group have decided to settle down and wait for a rescue. The group was due back yesterday; someone should be out looking in the morning. And who knows? Maybe you'll find the trail again when daylight returns. The next day, you notice one of your mates isn't around. You start to wonder where they've gone when you hear a scream from the dense forest. Someone comes crashing through the brush into camp, covered in blood. "He's dead!" Out here in the middle of nowhere, you know you're the only people within 100 miles. "Who would do this?" you think, scanning your mates' faces for signs of guilt. You thought you'd heard someone say yesterday there were too many people and not enough food, but could they really have gone to this extreme? You have to get to the bottom of this, and punish the one responsible. But who?




MINI 1481 ENDS IN A
TOWN
WIN!
.

Rules

* Stolen from Equinox <3 *

All rules listed in the Boilerplate Game Rules page apply to this game except where contradicted in the additional rules below, in which case the following rules will take precedence:
  1. Blue
    is reserved for the moderator. All other formatting is fair game with the provision that you do not impersonate me.
  2. Flavor is for entertainment purposes only and has no significance in the game.
  3. Days will have a deadline of two weeks, and Nights will last 48 hours. Deadline extensions will be granted only in extreme circumstances.
  4. Prods will be issued to players if they have not posted within a 48-hour period. Players who have been prodded have 48 hours to respond in the game thread before a replacement is sought.
  5. Votes must be cast using this format:

    Code: Select all

    [b]Vote:ETL[/b]
    or by using the VOTE: tags, like this:

    Code: Select all

    [vote]ETL[/vote]
    . If it looks like you're voting, it will be counted.
  6. Lynches occur through simple majority (50% of living players + 1, rounded down). If no majority is reached at deadline or there is a majority of votes for No Lynch, the Day will end without a lynch. Once majority is reached, no further votes or unvotes will count.
  7. All players, including the lynched player, are allowed to discuss in twilight phase until I post the death scene. Day ends when the moderator locks the thread.
    Dead players may NOT post again until the game is over (i.e. no Bah! posts allowed).
  8. If I do not receive your action by deadline, your action is forfeited. You may submit ahead of time; you can also make as many changes as necessary, and at deadline I will take the last action you submitted. Actions may be submitted via PM or QuickTopic. I will send reminders 24 hours before Night is scheduled to end.
  9. All actions will be processed according to Natural Action Resolution.
  10. Any situation not covered above will be handled on a case-by-case basis.
Sample Role PM

You are a
Vanilla Townie
.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one member of the town remains standing.

All roles have been sent out! Please confirm
in-thread
. Once 10 of 13 have confirmed, or the deadline for confirmation has been reached, the game will begin.

The deadline for confirmation is Thursday, August 1, 2013 at 19:00 EST, or in (expired on 2013-08-01 19:00:00). Any players who have not opened their Role PM by this time will be replaced.

A note on the RB/JK interaction:
I am dumb and this is my first game modding. I should not have included both in this setup. It was discussed during review and when the actions were sent in Night 1, and decided that all blocks happen and no kill occurs. The wiki is vague on this particular point because the block function of the jail keeper role is the same as the role blocker, and has the same "importance". I've heard people say the Role Blocker takes priority and I've heard people say neither. Either way, I made a decision and let the game play out.
